main event: A witness in Columbus, Ohio reported seeing a bright, white, round object like a magnesium flare at high altitude for about 1 minute on September 20, 1960.
interesting points: The object was described as a ball of fire moving from south to north at about 60 degrees elevation.
The object seemed to have a trail of white sparks following the main body.
The object made no sound and was estimated to be at an altitude of 2 to 3 miles.
The estimated size of the object was 5 times the diameter of the main body, or the size of a 'full moon'.
The object was seen to be trailing something and sparks were seen trailing from it.
sighted object: a bright, white, round object like a magnesium flare
